description: Loads a file as a Spark Model.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: Path of the csv file.

description: PandasSelectRows manages selection of rows, which can later be filtered or deleted.

parameter.name: select_nan
parameter.description: Whether to select rows with at least one NaN value.

parameter.name: conditions
parameter.description: List of conditions to select rows.

description: Node that returns the predictions performed with a ZScore model on the columns of a dataset.

parameter.name: columns
parameter.description: Column names to apply ZScore to. Empty to use all columns.

parameter.name: threshold
parameter.description: The threshold of the ZScore to distinguish anomalies.

description: Computes the Davies-Bouldin score using the 'sklearn.metrics.davies_bouldin_score'. The score is defined as the average similarity measure of each cluster with its most similar cluster, where similarity is the ratio of within-cluster distances to between-cluster distances. Thus, clusters which are farther apart and less dispersed will result in a better score. The minimum score is zero, with lower values indicating better clustering.
Represent a SparkNode that supports fitting traditional logistic regression model.

parameter.name: max_iter
parameter.description: Max number of iterations.

parameter.name: reg_param
parameter.description: Regularization parameter.

description: SparkColumnSelector manages filtering of rows, columns and values for a Spark DataFrame.

parameter.name: column_list
parameter.description: List of columns to select from the dataset

parameter.name: filter_list
parameter.description: List of conditions used to filter the rows of the dataset

description: Save a trained PipelineModel

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: String representing the path where to save the model.

description: Writes a pandas DataFrame into a CSV file.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: Of the CSV file.

parameter.name: delim
parameter.description: Delimiter symbol of the CSV file.

parameter.name: include_rows
parameter.description: Whether to include rows indexes.

parameter.name: rows_column_label
parameter.description: If rows indexes must be included you can give a name to its column.

parameter.name: include_columns
parameter.description: Whether to include column names.

parameter.name: columns
parameter.description: If column names must be included you can give names to them. The order is relevant.

description: Node that trains a model using the HalfSpaceTree algorithm.

parameter.name: window_size
parameter.description: The size of the window.

parameter.name: num_trees
parameter.description: The number of trees.

parameter.name: initial_window_x
parameter.description: The initial window to fit for initial calibration period. If not None, we simply apply fit to these instances.

parameter.name: max_depth
parameter.description: The maximum depth of the trees.

description: Represent a Spark Tokenizer used to split text in individual term.

parameter.name: in_col
parameter.description: The name of the input column.

parameter.name: out_col
parameter.description: The name of the output column.

description: Node that returns the predictions performed with a TPOT Classification model on the columns of a dataset without the target feature column.
Node used to add a column to a Pandas Dataframe starting from a given Pandas Series.

parameter.name: loc
parameter.description: Insertion index. Must verify 0 <= loc <= len(columns)

parameter.name: col
parameter.description: Label of the inserted column.

description: PandasColumnsFiltering manages filtering of columns. This node gives access to several functionalities such as: - select columns by their indexes; - select columns by their names (labels); - select columns containing a substring in their names; - select columns that match a regex; - select columns in a range of indexes; - assign a type to a column. Every parameter but 'columns_type' is mutually exclusive, meaning that only one can be used.

parameter.name: column_indexes
parameter.description: Filters the dataset selecting the given indexes. Uses the pandas iloc function.

parameter.name: column_names
parameter.description: Filters the dataset selecting the given column labels. Uses the pandas filter function.

parameter.name: columns_like
parameter.description: Keep columns for which the given string is a substring of the column label.

parameter.name: columns_regex
parameter.description: Keep columns for which column labels match a given pattern.

parameter.name: columns_range
parameter.description: Keep columns for which index falls withing the given range (from, to (excluded)).

parameter.name: columns_type
parameter.description: Type to assign to columns. It can be either a string, meaning that it will try to apply the chosen type to all the columns, or a list of strings, one for each column, meaning that it will try to assign a chosen type to each column in order.

description: Represent a Spark Pipeline consisting of SparkNode (stages). It should contain some Spark Transformer and a final Spark Estimator that return the trained model.
This class provides an interface to convert the scores into probabilities through conformal prediction.

parameter.name: windowed
parameter.description: Whether the probability calibrator is windowed so that forget scores that are older than `window_size`.

parameter.name: window_size
parameter.description: The size of window for running average and std.

description: Sets column names for a pandas DataFrame.

parameter.name: columns
parameter.description: Column names to assign to the DataFrame. The order is relevant.

description: Class representing a PySad predictor, use the given model and dataset to obtain the predictions.
Drops rows or columns that either has at least a NaN value or that has all NaN values.

parameter.name: axis
parameter.description: The axis from where to remove the nan values.

parameter.name: how
parameter.description: Whether to remove a row or a column which either contains any nan value or contains all nan values.

description: PandasGroupBy manages filtering of rows that have been previously selected.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: Groupby key, which selects the grouping column of the target.

parameter.name: freq
parameter.description: This will groupby the specified frequency if the target selection (via key) is a datetime-like object. For full specification of available frequencies, please see `here  /pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/user_guide/timeseries.html#offset-aliases>`_.

parameter.name: axis
parameter.description: Number of the axis.

parameter.name: sort
parameter.description: Whether to sort the resulting labels.

parameter.name: dropna
parameter.description: If True, and if group keys contain NA values, NA values together with row/column will be dropped. If False, NA values will also be treated as the key in groups.

parameter.name: aggregates
parameter.description: The function used to aggregate the different columns during the GroupBy. It can be either a string, meaning that it will try to apply the chosen aggregation function to all the columns, or a list of strings, one for each column, meaning that it will try to assign a chosen type to each column in order.

parameter.description: Hostname or IP address or Unix domain socket path of a single MongoDB instance to connect to, or a mongodb URI

parameter.name: db
parameter.description: Name of the database to connect to.

parameter.name: coll
parameter.description: Name of the collection to connect to.

parameter.name: projection
parameter.description: A dict to exclude fields from the result (e.g. projection={'_id': False})

parameter.description: Seed for the random generation.

parameter.name: shuffle
parameter.description: Whether to shuffle the dataset before the splitting.

description: Node representation of a sklearn PCA estimator that uses the 'sklearn.decomposition.PCA'.

parameter.name: execute
parameter.description: List of strings to specify the methods to execute. The allowed strings are those from the _method attribute.

parameter.name: n_components
parameter.description: Number of components to keep.

parameter.name: whiten
parameter.description: When True (False by default) the components_ vectors are multiplied by the square root of n_samples and then divided by the singular values to ensure uncorrelated outputs with unit component-wise variances.

parameter.name: svd_solver
parameter.description: Svd solver.

parameter.name: tol
parameter.description: Tolerance for singular values computed by svd_solver == 'arpack'. Must be positive.

parameter.name: iterated_power
parameter.description: Number of iterations for the power method computed by svd_solver == 'randomized'. Must be positive.

parameter.name: random_state
parameter.description: Used when the 'arpack' or 'randomized' solvers are used. Pass an int for reproducible results across multiple function calls.

parameter.name: loss

parameter.name: dual
parameter.description: Dual.

parameter.name: tol
parameter.description: Tol.

parameter.name: C
parameter.description: C.

parameter.name: multi_class
parameter.description: Multi_class.

parameter.name: fit_intercept
parameter.description: Fit_intercept.

parameter.name: intercept_scaling
parameter.description: Intercept_scaling.

parameter.name: class_weight
parameter.description: Class_weight.

parameter.name: verbose
parameter.description: Verbose.

parameter.name: random_state
parameter.description: Random_state.

parameter.name: max_iter
parameter.description: Max_iter.

parameter.name: path

parameter.name: header
parameter.description: Uses the first line as names of columns.

parameter.name: schema
parameter.description: Infers the input schema automatically from data. It requires one extra pass over the data.

parameter.description: Percentage of the dataset to split into a train dataset.

parameter.name: test
parameter.description: Percentage of the dataset to split into a test dataset.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: String representing the path where to save the dataset

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: String representing the path where to save the dataset

description: Node that returns the model trained with the ZScore algorithm by analyzing the columns of the dataset.

parameter.name: columns
parameter.description: Column names to apply ZScore to. Empty to use all columns.

Represent a Spark HashingTF that maps a sequence of terms to their term frequencies using the hashing trick.

parameter.name: in_col
parameter.description: The name of the input column.

parameter.name: out_col
parameter.description: The name of the output column.

description: Node that loads a given object, for instance a trained model, stored in pickle format.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The path of the stored object/model.

description: Node used to replace the boolean values of a Pandas Series with other values given by the user.

parameter.name: first_value
parameter.description: Value used when the condition is True.

parameter.name: second_value
parameter.description: Value used when the condition is False.

description: PandasSequence wraps a list of nodes that must be executed in sequence into a single node. Intermediate values are passed along the chain using the 'dataset' variable, hence only PandasNodes can be used within a sequence.

parameter.name: stages
parameter.description: ordered in an execution sequence. They must all be PandasNodes, hence have a 'dataset' variable used for input and output.

description: Node that returns the classification model trained with the TPOT library.

parameter.name: target_feature
parameter.description: Name of the target feature.

parameter.name: export_script
parameter.description: Whether to export the resulting Python script.

parameter.name: generations
parameter.description: Number of iterations to the run pipeline optimization process. It must be a positive number. If not set, the parameter max_time_mins must be defined as the runtime limit. Generally, TPOT will work better when you give it more generations (and therefore time) to optimize the pipeline. TPOT will evaluate POPULATION_SIZE + GENERATIONS x OFFSPRING_SIZE pipelines in total.

parameter.name: population_size
parameter.description: Number of individuals to retain in the GP population every generation. Generally, TPOT will work better when you give it more individuals (and therefore time) to optimize the pipeline. TPOT will evaluate POPULATION_SIZE + GENERATIONS x OFFSPRING_SIZE pipelines in total.

parameter.name: offspring_size
parameter.description: Number of offspring to produce in each GP generation. By default, offspring_size = population_size.

parameter.name: mutation_rate
parameter.description: Mutation rate for the genetic programming algorithm in the range [0.0, 1.0]. This parameter tells the GP algorithm how many pipelines to apply random changes to every generation. We recommend using the default parameter unless you understand how the mutation rate affects GP algorithms.

parameter.name: crossover_rate
parameter.description: Crossover rate for the genetic programming algorithm in the range [0.0, 1.0]. This parameter tells the genetic programming algorithm how many pipelines to "breed" every generation. We recommend using the default parameter unless you understand how the mutation rate affects GP algorithms.

parameter.name: scoring
parameter.description: Function used to evaluate the quality of a given pipeline for the problem. By default, accuracy is used for classification problems. Offers the same options as sklearn.model_selection.cross_val_score as well as a built-in score 'balanced_accuracy'. Classification metrics: ['accuracy', 'adjusted_rand_score', 'average_precision', 'balanced_accuracy', 'f1', 'f1_macro', 'f1_micro', 'f1_samples', 'f1_weighted', 'precision', 'precision_macro', 'precision_micro', 'precision_samples', 'precision_weighted', 'recall', 'recall_macro', 'recall_micro', 'recall_samples', 'recall_weighted', 'roc_auc']

parameter.name: cv
parameter.description: The number of folds to evaluate each pipeline over in k-fold cross-validation during the TPOT optimization process.

parameter.name: subsample
parameter.description: Subsample ratio of the training instance. Setting it to 0.5 means that TPOT randomly collects half of training samples for pipeline optimization process.

parameter.name: n_jobs
parameter.description: Number of CPUs for evaluating pipelines in parallel during the TPOT optimization process. Assigning this to -1 will use as many cores as available on the computer. For n_jobs below -1, (n_cpus + 1 + n_jobs) are used. Thus for n_jobs = -2, all CPUs but one are used.

parameter.name: max_time_mins
parameter.description: How many minutes TPOT has to optimize the pipeline. If not None, this setting will allow TPOT to run until max_time_mins minutes elapsed and then stop. TPOT will stop earlier if generationsis set and all generations are already evaluated.

parameter.name: max_eval_time_mins
parameter.description: How many minutes TPOT has to optimize a single pipeline. Setting this parameter to higher values will allow TPOT to explore more complex pipelines, but will also allow TPOT to run longer.

parameter.name: random_state
parameter.description: Random number generator seed for TPOT. Use this parameter to make sure that TPOT will give you the same results each time you run it against the same data set with that seed.

parameter.name: config_dict
parameter.description: String 'TPOT light':     TPOT uses a light version of operator configuration dictionary instead of     the default one. String 'TPOT MDR':     TPOT uses a list of TPOT-MDR operator configuration dictionary instead of     the default one. String 'TPOT sparse':     TPOT uses a configuration dictionary with a one-hot-encoder and the     operators normally included in TPOT that also support sparse matrices. String 'TPOT NN':     TPOT uses a configuration dictionary for PyTorch neural network classifiers     included in `tpot.nn`.

parameter.name: template
parameter.description: Template of predefined pipeline structure. The option is for specifying a desired structure for the machine learning pipeline evaluated in TPOT. So far this option only supports linear pipeline structure. Each step in the pipeline should be a main class of operators (Selector, Transformer, Classifier or Regressor) or a specific operator (e.g. SelectPercentile) defined in TPOT operator configuration. If one step is a main class, TPOT will randomly assign all subclass operators (subclasses of SelectorMixin, TransformerMixin, ClassifierMixin or RegressorMixin in scikit-learn) to that step. Steps in the template are delimited by "-", e.g. "SelectPercentile-Transformer-Classifier". By default value of template is None, TPOT generates tree-based pipeline randomly.

parameter.name: warm_start
parameter.description: Flag indicating whether the TPOT instance will reuse the population from previous calls to fit().

parameter.name: memory
parameter.description: If supplied, pipeline will cache each transformer after calling fit. This feature is used to avoid computing the fit transformers within a pipeline if the parameters and input data are identical with another fitted pipeline during optimization process. String 'auto':     TPOT uses memory caching with a temporary directory and cleans it up upon shutdown. String path of a caching directory     TPOT uses memory caching with the provided directory and TPOT does NOT clean     the caching directory up upon shutdown. If the directory does not exist, TPOT will     create it. None:     TPOT does not use memory caching.

parameter.name: use_dask
parameter.description: Whether to use Dask-ML's pipeline optimizations. This avoid re-fitting the same estimator on the same split of data multiple times. It will also provide more detailed diagnostics when using Dask's distributed scheduler.

parameter.name: periodic_checkpoint_folder
parameter.description: If supplied, a folder in which tpot will periodically save pipelines in pareto front so far while optimizing. Currently once per generation but not more often than once per 30 seconds. Useful in multiple cases:     Sudden death before tpot could save optimized pipeline     Track its progress     Grab pipelines while it's still optimizing

parameter.name: early_stop
parameter.description: How many generations TPOT checks whether there is no improvement in optimization process. End optimization process if there is no improvement in the set number of generations.

parameter.name: verbosity
parameter.description: How much information TPOT communicates while it's running. 0 = none, 1 = minimal, 2 = high, 3 = all. A setting of 2 or higher will add a progress bar during the optimization procedure.

parameter.name: log_file
parameter.description: Save progress content to a file.

description: Loads a pandas DataFrame from a CSV file.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: Of the CSV file.

parameter.name: delim
parameter.description: Delimiter symbol of the CSV file.

description: Transforms a DataFrame into a Pivot table from the given rows, columns and values.

parameter.name: rows
parameter.description: Name of the column whose values will be the rows of the pivot.

parameter.name: columns
parameter.description: Name of the column whose values will be the columns of the pivot.

parameter.name: values
parameter.description: Name of the column whose values will be the values of the pivot.

parameter.name: aggfunc
parameter.description: Function to use for the aggregation.

parameter.name: fill_value
parameter.description: Value to replace missing values with.

parameter.name: dropna
parameter.description: Do not include columns whose entries are all NaN.

parameter.name: sort
parameter.description: Specifies if the result should be sorted.

description: Loads the iris dataset as a pandas DataFrame using the 'sklearn.datasets.load_iris'.

parameter.name: separate_target
parameter.description: Whether to get the target labels in the separated output 'target'.

description: Node that returns the regression model trained with the TPOT library.

parameter.name: target_feature
parameter.description: Name of the target feature.

parameter.name: export_script
parameter.description: Whether to export the resulting Python script.

parameter.name: generations
parameter.description: Number of iterations to the run pipeline optimization process. It must be a positive number. If not set, the parameter max_time_mins must be defined as the runtime limit. Generally, TPOT will work better when you give it more generations (and therefore time) to optimize the pipeline. TPOT will evaluate POPULATION_SIZE + GENERATIONS x OFFSPRING_SIZE pipelines in total.

parameter.name: population_size
parameter.description: Number of individuals to retain in the GP population every generation. Generally, TPOT will work better when you give it more individuals (and therefore time) to optimize the pipeline. TPOT will evaluate POPULATION_SIZE + GENERATIONS x OFFSPRING_SIZE pipelines in total.

parameter.name: offspring_size
parameter.description: Number of offspring to produce in each GP generation. By default, offspring_size = population_size.

parameter.name: mutation_rate
parameter.description: Mutation rate for the genetic programming algorithm in the range [0.0, 1.0]. This parameter tells the GP algorithm how many pipelines to apply random changes to every generation. We recommend using the default parameter unless you understand how the mutation rate affects GP algorithms.

parameter.name: crossover_rate
parameter.description: Crossover rate for the genetic programming algorithm in the range [0.0, 1.0]. This parameter tells the genetic programming algorithm how many pipelines to "breed" every generation. We recommend using the default parameter unless you understand how the mutation rate affects GP algorithms.

parameter.name: scoring
parameter.description: Function used to evaluate the quality of a given pipeline for the problem. By default, mean squared error (MSE) is used for regression problems. Offers the same options as sklearn.model_selection.cross_val_score as well as a built-in score 'balanced_accuracy'. Regression metrics: ['neg_median_absolute_error', 'neg_mean_absolute_error', 'neg_mean_squared_error', 'r2']

parameter.name: cv
parameter.description: The number of folds to evaluate each pipeline over in k-fold cross-validation during the TPOT optimization process.

parameter.name: subsample
parameter.description: Subsample ratio of the training instance. Setting it to 0.5 means that TPOT randomly collects half of training samples for pipeline optimization process.

parameter.name: n_jobs
parameter.description: Number of CPUs for evaluating pipelines in parallel during the TPOT optimization process. Assigning this to -1 will use as many cores as available on the computer. For n_jobs below -1, (n_cpus + 1 + n_jobs) are used. Thus for n_jobs = -2, all CPUs but one are used.

parameter.name: max_time_mins
parameter.description: How many minutes TPOT has to optimize the pipeline. If not None, this setting will allow TPOT to run until max_time_mins minutes elapsed and then stop. TPOT will stop earlier if generationsis set and all generations are already evaluated.

parameter.name: max_eval_time_mins
parameter.description: How many minutes TPOT has to optimize a single pipeline. Setting this parameter to higher values will allow TPOT to explore more complex pipelines, but will also allow TPOT to run longer.

parameter.name: random_state
parameter.description: Random number generator seed for TPOT. Use this parameter to make sure that TPOT will give you the same results each time you run it against the same data set with that seed.

parameter.name: config_dict
parameter.description: String 'TPOT light':     TPOT uses a light version of operator configuration dictionary instead of     the default one. String 'TPOT MDR':     TPOT uses a list of TPOT-MDR operator configuration dictionary instead of     the default one. String 'TPOT sparse':     TPOT uses a configuration dictionary with a one-hot-encoder and the     operators normally included in TPOT that also support sparse matrices. String 'TPOT NN':     TPOT uses a configuration dictionary for PyTorch neural network classifiers     included in `tpot.nn`.

parameter.name: template
parameter.description: Template of predefined pipeline structure. The option is for specifying a desired structure for the machine learning pipeline evaluated in TPOT. So far this option only supports linear pipeline structure. Each step in the pipeline should be a main class of operators (Selector, Transformer, Classifier or Regressor) or a specific operator (e.g. SelectPercentile) defined in TPOT operator configuration. If one step is a main class, TPOT will randomly assign all subclass operators (subclasses of SelectorMixin, TransformerMixin, ClassifierMixin or RegressorMixin in scikit-learn) to that step. Steps in the template are delimited by "-", e.g. "SelectPercentile-Transformer-Classifier". By default value of template is None, TPOT generates tree-based pipeline randomly.

parameter.name: warm_start
parameter.description: Flag indicating whether the TPOT instance will reuse the population from previous calls to fit().

parameter.name: memory
parameter.description: If supplied, pipeline will cache each transformer after calling fit. This feature is used to avoid computing the fit transformers within a pipeline if the parameters and input data are identical with another fitted pipeline during optimization process. String 'auto':     TPOT uses memory caching with a temporary directory and cleans it up upon shutdown. String path of a caching directory     TPOT uses memory caching with the provided directory and TPOT does NOT clean     the caching directory up upon shutdown. If the directory does not exist, TPOT will     create it. None:     TPOT does not use memory caching.

parameter.name: use_dask
parameter.description: Whether to use Dask-ML's pipeline optimizations. This avoid re-fitting the same estimator on the same split of data multiple times. It will also provide more detailed diagnostics when using Dask's distributed scheduler.

parameter.name: periodic_checkpoint_folder
parameter.description: If supplied, a folder in which tpot will periodically save pipelines in pareto front so far while optimizing. parameter.name: verbosity
